articles.title: Coronavirus Ireland: Funerals should be attended by no more than 10 people, public advised - Irish Mirror
articles.description: Due to the Covid-19 crisis, only immediate family members are advised to go to funeral services, burials and cremations
articles.content:
No more than 10 people should attend funerals in Ireland during the Covid-19 pandemic.
As the number of cases rises to almost 3,000 nationwide, the public is being advised that only immediate family should attend.

articles.description: The hawksbill sea turtle hatchlings had a beach to themselves thanks to coronavirus restrictions in Brazil.
articles.content:

articles.title: No proof drug touted by Trump drug is effective against coronavirus: EU - Reuters
articles.description: The European Commission said on Tuesday there was no evidence that a drug touted by U.S. President Donald Trump as a potential miracle cure against COVID-19 was effective against the disease caused by the new coronavirus.
